item.title: Presentations at the British Society for Population Studies conference
item.dc:creator: Francisco Rowe
item.description: The DEBIAS team participated in the British Society for Population Studies conference in Bath. Francisco organised and chaired the session “Migration 2: Migration, digital traces and methodological innovations”. Carmen delivered a talk on the use of mobile phone data from Meta to assess the medium-term impact of COVID-19 on mobility in Latin American countries. The DEBIAS team have developed a methodology to address some key biases in these data. Keeps your eyes peeled for the publication coming up.

item.title: Keynote at the Annual Conference on Complex Systems
item.dc:creator: Carmen Cabrera-Arnau
item.description: Digital trace data, such as location data collected from smartphone apps, offers a unique opportunity to analyse population movements at high spatiotemporal granularity, with extensive coverage in near real-time. Yet, a key challenge for its use in human mobility research and evidence-based policymaking is the presence of biases. These issues were addressed in the keynote talk titled “Leveraging digital trace data for human mobility research” and delivered at UrbanSys, a satellite session within the Conference on Complex Systems, taking place in Exeter (UK) in early September 2024.
